DataType.Description: Describes the possible job order commands.

DefaultValue.uax:ListOfExtensionObject:
i=7616
0
Undefined_0
Undefined value, should never be seen.
i=7616
1
Store_1
Command to store the job order in local storage, but not to start the order.
i=7616
2
StoreAndStart_2
Command to store the job order and start it as soon as the Job Order receiver is ready to start.
i=7616
3
Start_3
Command to start a stored job order as soon as the receiver is ready to start. Only the Job Orders ID is used to identify the stored job order, all other information is not used. No changes are made to the stored order. If multiple Job Orders have been commanded to Start, then the priority and timing values in the Job Orders shall be used to determine the order of execution of the orders.
i=7616
4
Update_4
Command to update a stored Job Order that has not yet been started, with the new order information. All previously stored information is replaced.
i=7616
5
Stop_5
Command to stop a started job order, report on any work done on the order, and remove the stored information. Only the Job Orders ID is used to identify the job order, all other information is not used.
i=7616
6
Cancel_6
Cancel an un-started job order and remove the stored information. Only the Job Orders ID is used to identify the job order, all other information is not used.
i=7616
7
Clear_7
Command to allow the Information Receiver to clear any maintained information on the Job Order (usually sent after a receipt of a Job Response with a status of Finished.) Only the Job Orders ID is used to identify the job order, all other information is not used.

Field.Name: Undefined_0
Field.Description: Undefined value, should never be seen.

Field.Name: Store_1
Field.Description: Command to store the job order in local storage, but not to start the order.

Field.Name: StoreAndStart_2
Field.Description: Command to store the job order and start it as soon as the Job Order receiver is ready to start.

Field.Name: Start_3
Field.Description: Command to start a stored job order as soon as the receiver is ready to start. Only the Job Orders ID is used to identify the stored job order, all other information is not used. No changes are made to the stored order. If multiple Job Orders have been commanded to Start, then the priority and timing values in the Job Orders shall be used to determine the order of execution of the orders.

Field.Name: Update_4
Field.Description: Command to update a stored Job Order that has not yet been started, with the new order information. All previously stored information is replaced.

Field.Name: Stop_5
Field.Description: Command to stop a started job order, report on any work done on the order, and remove the stored information. Only the Job Orders ID is used to identify the job order, all other information is not used.

Field.Name: Cancel_6
Field.Description: Cancel an un-started job order and remove the stored information. Only the Job Orders ID is used to identify the job order, all other information is not used.

Field.Name: Clear_7
Field.Description: Command to allow the Information Receiver to clear any maintained information on the Job Order (usually sent after a receipt of a Job Response with a status of Finished.) Only the Job Orders ID is used to identify the job order, all other information is not used.

DataType.Description: Describes the possible serial number statesjob order states.

DefaultValue.uax:ListOfExtensionObject:
i=7616
0
Undefined_0
defined value, should never be seen.
i=7616
1
Waiting_1
The necessary pre-conditions have not been met and the order is not ready to run.
i=7616
2
Ready_2
The necessary pre-conditions have been met and the order is ready to run, awaiting a Start command.
i=7616
3
Loaded_3
In situations where only one job may be in active memory and is able to be run, then the job is loaded in active memory, the necessary pre-conditions have been met, and the order is ready to run, awaiting a Start command.
i=7616
4
Running_4
The order is executing.
i=7616
5
Completed_5
The order has been completed and are no longer in execution.
i=7616
6
Aborted_6
The order was aborted.
i=7616
7
Held_7
The order has been temporarily stopped due to a constraint of some form.
i=7616
8
Suspended_8
The order has been temporarily stopped due to a deliberate decision within the execution system.
i=7616
9
Closed_9
The order has been completed and fully reconciled. No further changes, or restatement of actuals is expected.

Field.Name: Undefined_0
Field.Description: defined value, should never be seen.

Field.Name: Waiting_1
Field.Description: The necessary pre-conditions have not been met and the order is not ready to run.

Field.Name: Ready_2
Field.Description: The necessary pre-conditions have been met and the order is ready to run, awaiting a Start command.

Field.Name: Loaded_3
Field.Description: In situations where only one job may be in active memory and is able to be run, then the job is loaded in active memory, the necessary pre-conditions have been met, and the order is ready to run, awaiting a Start command.

Field.Name: Running_4
Field.Description: The order is executing.

Field.Name: Completed_5
Field.Description: The order has been completed and are no longer in execution.

Field.Name: Aborted_6
Field.Description: The order was aborted.

Field.Name: Held_7
Field.Description: The order has been temporarily stopped due to a constraint of some form.

Field.Name: Suspended_8
Field.Description: The order has been temporarily stopped due to a deliberate decision within the execution system.

Field.Name: Closed_9
Field.Description: The order has been completed and fully reconciled. No further changes, or restatement of actuals is expected.

DefaultValue.uax:ListOfExtensionObject:
i=7616
0
Undefined0
Undefined value, should never be seen.
i=7616
1
NoError1
There were no errors in processing the method.
i=7616
2
InvalidSerialNumberCollection2
The Serial Number Collection ID does not match a Serial Number Collection managed by the server.
i=7616
3
InsufficientSerialNumbers3
Fewer Serial Numbers are available from the pool, then are requested.
i=7616
4
InvalidSerialNumbersFormat4
The serial number format is not known or defined in the server
i=7616
5
InvalidRequestToken5
The Request Token has a value not understood by the server.
i=7616
6
InvalidSelectionCriteria6
The Selection Criteria is not known or defined in the server.
i=7616
7
UnableToAcceptSerialNumberEvents7
The server cannot accept Serial Number events.
i=7616
8
UnableToAcceptLabelEvents8
The server cannot accept Label events.
i=7616
9
UnableToAcceptSIDEvents9
The server cannot accept SID events.
i=7616
10
UnknownAggregationSID10
The SID of the aggregation for packing or unpacking is unknown.
i=7616
11
InsufficientPrivilegeToExecute11
The server has determined that the client does not have sufficient privilege for the method to execute.

Field.Name: Undefined0
Field.Description: Undefined value, should never be seen.

Field.Name: NoError1
Field.Description: There were no errors in processing the method.

Field.Name: InvalidSerialNumberCollection2
Field.Description: The Serial Number Collection ID does not match a Serial Number Collection managed by the server.

Field.Name: InsufficientSerialNumbers3
Field.Description: Fewer Serial Numbers are available from the pool, then are requested.

Field.Name: InvalidSerialNumbersFormat4
Field.Description: The serial number format is not known or defined in the server

Field.Name: InvalidRequestToken5
Field.Description: The Request Token has a value not understood by the server.

Field.Name: InvalidSelectionCriteria6
Field.Description: The Selection Criteria is not known or defined in the server.

Field.Name: UnableToAcceptSerialNumberEvents7
Field.Description: The server cannot accept Serial Number events.

Field.Name: UnableToAcceptLabelEvents8
Field.Description: The server cannot accept Label events.

Field.Name: UnableToAcceptSIDEvents9
Field.Description: The server cannot accept SID events.

Field.Name: UnknownAggregationSID10
Field.Description: The SID of the aggregation for packing or unpacking is unknown.

Field.Name: InsufficientPrivilegeToExecute11
Field.Description: The server has determined that the client does not have sufficient privilege for the method to execute.

DefaultValue.uax:ListOfExtensionObject:
i=7616
0
Unassigned0
The Serial Number has not been assigned to production or a packaging run.
i=7616
1
Unallocated1
As Serial Number has been assigned to production or a packaging run, but it has not yet been allocated for use a specific production run of a product or aggregation.
i=7616
2
Allocated2
The Serial Number has been assigned to a specific product or aggregation production run.
i=7616
3
SNInvalid3
The Serial Number is no longer viable, and the related serial number is no longer defined.
i=7616
4
Encoded4
The Serial Number has been written to a barcode or RFID tag, but not yet commissioned.
i=7616
5
LabelSampled5
The printed label has been retained and is not associated with a physical product or aggregation.
i=7616
6
LabelScrapped6
A label was encoded with a Serial Number, but was made unusable before being applied to a product or aggregation.
i=7616
7
Commissioned7
The Serial Number has been associated with a physical product or aggregation, but has not yet left the responsibility of production
i=7616
8
Sampled8
The product or aggregation is to be used as a sample for testing or other use, not to be made active.
i=7616
9
Inactive9
The product or aggregation is no longer active, but may not have been destroyed.
i=7616
10
Destroyed10
The product or aggregation was has been fully rendered non-usable.
i=7616
11
Released11
The Serial Number has been associated with a physical product or aggregation, and has left the responsibility of production.

Field.Name: Unassigned0
Field.Description: The Serial Number has not been assigned to production or a packaging run.

Field.Name: Unallocated1
Field.Description: As Serial Number has been assigned to production or a packaging run, but it has not yet been allocated for use a specific production run of a product or aggregation.

Field.Name: Allocated2
Field.Description: The Serial Number has been assigned to a specific product or aggregation production run.

Field.Name: SNInvalid3
Field.Description: The Serial Number is no longer viable, and the related serial number is no longer defined.

Field.Name: Encoded4
Field.Description: The Serial Number has been written to a barcode or RFID tag, but not yet commissioned.

Field.Name: LabelSampled5
Field.Description: The printed label has been retained and is not associated with a physical product or aggregation.

Field.Name: LabelScrapped6
Field.Description: A label was encoded with a Serial Number, but was made unusable before being applied to a product or aggregation.

Field.Name: Commissioned7
Field.Description: The Serial Number has been associated with a physical product or aggregation, but has not yet left the responsibility of production

Field.Name: Sampled8
Field.Description: The product or aggregation is to be used as a sample for testing or other use, not to be made active.

Field.Name: Inactive9
Field.Description: The product or aggregation is no longer active, but may not have been destroyed.

Field.Name: Destroyed10
Field.Description: The product or aggregation was has been fully rendered non-usable.

Field.Name: Released11
Field.Description: The Serial Number has been associated with a physical product or aggregation, and has left the responsibility of production.

DataType.Description: Iidentifies a parent element and a collection of packed elements. This is used in the aggregation packing and unpacking methods.

Field.Name: ParentElement
Field.Description: Identifies the single serial number representing the aggregation which acts as the parent

Field.Name: ParentElementCollection
Field.Description: Identifies the Serial Number Collection that was added to, or removed from, the parent element.

Field.Name: ID
Field.Description: An identification of the Collection. It usually refers to a specific packaging level of a specific product.

Field.Name: Description
Field.Description: Additional information and description about the Collection.

Field.Name: State
Field.Description: State of the Serial Numbers in the Collection.

Field.Name: AssociatedPoolID
Field.Description: An identification of the Serial Number Pool from which the Serial Numbers were obtained.

Field.Name: SerialNumbers
Field.Description: Array of Serial Numbers in the collection.

Field.Name: LabelCollection
Field.Description: The collections of labels with serial numbers.

Field.Name: LabelCollectionProperties
Field.Description: An optional array of additional properties in the form of Key/Value pairs which are valid for the whole collection.

DataType.Description: Defines the generateOptions argument for an EPCISStream GenerateFileForWrite method. It defines the serial number format information for object events and for aggregation events, and event context information.

Field.Name: SNFormat
Field.Description: The format for of serial numbers in object events, can be a null string if there are no object events in the transferred events.

Field.Name: ParentSNFormat
Field.Description: The format for of parent serial numbers in aggregation events, can be a null string if there are no aggregation events in the transferred events.

Field.Name: PackedElementSNFormat
Field.Description: The format for of packed element serial numbers in aggregation events, can be a null string if there are no aggregation events in the transferred events.

Field.Name: EventContext
Field.Description: Zero or more key value pairs that define additional context information for the event, such as order number or lot number.

Field.Name: Key
Field.Description: A string defining the key for the pair

Field.Name: Value
Field.Description: A variant for the value of the pair structure

DataType.Description: Defines a single serial number and label, which may be associated with an SID, and collection of properties in the form of OPENSCSKeyValueDataType.

Field.Name: ID
Field.Description: The serial number of the label in the SID or EPC format.

Field.Name: LabelProperties
Field.Description: An optional array of additional properties in the form of Key/Value pairs

Field.Name: PropertyID
Field.Description: The identification of a property associated with a label.

Field.Name: PropertyDescription
Field.Description: An optional description of the property associated with the label

Field.Name: PropertyValue
Field.Description: A value for the property, if defined this may be considered a default property value.

Field.Name: PropertyID
Field.Description: An identification of the SID Class Property.

Field.Name: PropertyDescription
Field.Description: Additional information and description about the SID Class Property.

Field.Name: PropertyValue
Field.Description: Defines value for the specific SID Class Property. The format is not defined in this specification and must be negotiated between Information Providers and Information Requesters during design or change management of a system.

Field.Name: LabelProperty
Field.Description: An array of property elements, each of which may have associated label property definitions.

ObjectType.Description: The aggregation manager receives unsolicited events through the aggregation methods. The aggregation methods have the same method signature.
